page.title: 07TRAFFIC/TRANSPORT CRANAGE
page.content: We did two traffic counts, one of 20 minutes outside our school,when we counted some 70 vehicles passing along the A50. The second count we did at junction 18 when we counted 307 northbound and 317 southbound vehicles in 10 minutes! The largest number of vehicles on the M6 was cars, but there were also 160 lorries. These would not only be very noisy but also extremely dangerous if they were passing our school. Although our area has these major roads we have a very poor public transport service. The nearest station is in Holmes Chapel and there are only a few buses each week. As most people work away from Cranage, or live on outlying farms most people have at least one car.
